titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Detroit Institute of Technology records,1910-1982.
titlestmt.author: Justin Lee Tyler

repository.corpname: Detroit Public Library. Burton Historical Collection.

did.abstract: Consists mainly of reports, correspondence and publications of various parts of the university. Includes original brochures and flyers from the Detroit Technical Institute, catalogs, the student newspaper Technonian (1826-1981), the yearbook under its various names of Detroit Technonian, Panorama, Technorama (1930-1977) and catalogs. Also information on buildings used by the university including the Kresge headquarters, Colony Club and old YMCA.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Detroit Institute of Technology began in 1877 as part of the Detroit YMCA, at first offering night classes only, chiefly business classes to men in the area. In 1891, the school was known as the Young Men's Christian Association Institute. Five years later the school was incorporated as Detroit Technical Institute and 1918 was reorganized with the Colleges of Business Administration and Engineering, and the name changed to Detroit Institute of Technology. Women were first admitted to the school during World War II. The school closed in 1981.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: I. Administration; II. Faculty; III. Finance; IV. Publicity; V. Students; VI. Photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research use.

prefercite.p: Detroit Institute of Technology Collection, Burton Historical Collection, Detroit Public Library.

otherfindaid.head: Other finding aids note
otherfindaid.p: Finding aid and white index cards available in the Burton Historical Collection and on the World Wide Web.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.

did.unittitle: North Central Association of Colleges and Secondary Schools, Correspondence, 1962-1979
Association of Independent Colleges and Universities of Michigan (AICUM)

Proceedings of the Conference on Education in Computer Technology, 1972

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Faculty and staff reports, committees, memos and publications are included here. Items on various departments are also in this series.

did.unittitle: Subseries A: Committees/General Faculty Council Subseries B: Departments
Standing Comittees, Public Information Services Committee, 1958-1971
American Federation of Teachers and Michigan Federation of Teachers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material concerning financial aid for students, faculty salaries and other financial matters are cont :d in this series. As i.s on Gifts and Grants lists all those received from 1974 to 1981.

did.unittitle: Title I: Higher Education Act of 1965,Information Bulletins and Correspondence
Title I: Higher Education Act of 1965, Proposals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The oldest items in the collection are contained in this series, with catalogs dating from 1910 and flyers advertising Detroit Technical Institute. Other items include materials on the various anniversary celebrations, particularly the 75th in 1966. Information on the different buildings used by the university, such as the old Kresge Headquarters, are also here, as well as the history of the school and special events.

did.unittitle: Anniversary Celebrations, 75th Anniversary, 1966, Arts and Sciences Dept.

Subseries A: Newspaper Clippings and Press Releases
Press Releases and Newspaper Clippings, Jan-June 1949
Press Releases and Newspaper Clippings, Sept.-Dec. 1949

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Though no student records are included in this collection, there is a nearly complete collection of student newspapers dating from 1926 through 1981, and yearbooks from 1930 to 1977. Commencement programs from 1912 through 1980 are also contained here.

did.unittitle: Awards, Associated Collegiate Press of N.S.P.A., 1941-1945

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of all phases of university life
